column4: Anyone here proficent with dual booting Win 7 & 9.10?  I've been messing with this for 8 hours today and am still at square one.
I have installed win 7, then ubuntu 9.10.  But Grub2 is failing to see the win 7 partition and never gives me the option to choose it.
you know how to edit the grub menu?
have you tried adding the entry in the grub menu manually?
are you sure that your Windows7 partition is still good to go?
Well, i did a clean of install of win 7 & left 80 gigs for Ubuntu.
I'm in the process of re-installing 9.10.
I was just reading on how to edit the grub menu.  It appears you hit E when it shows up.
and when you installed Ubuntu you made sure that you manually assigned the install and boot partition?
well that is a temporary way to edit it .. boot into Ubuntu and edit it for good from within
I manually assigned the swap & / partitons.  but I left the rest alone.
sounds good - so you could see the Win partition but left it alone - ya?
Yes.  9.10 identified it as Win 7 bootloader but did not give the option to install it side by side and let me choose.
well if the partition is untouched then you should be looking to add the entry manually in the grub menu ....
What's the best way of going about that? :)
do you know where the grub file is? ....
btw this is the ultimate irony:  This is on a 20" imac that refuses to run any version of osx.  But it runs win 7 & ubuntu no problem.
I believe I read it was in the boot/grub/and it's a img file now?
the one I looked at earlier said not to edit this file haha.
yep .. seems like grub2 is a whole new kit and kaboodle
looks like this is for you :) https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Grub2#Adding%20Entries%20to%20Grub%202
That's very helpful thank you!
yw
